subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to test private member variables?
msgSnippet: ... This last suggestion is good to get tests passing. Refactor the needs for those methods away once the tests pass. J. B. Rainsberger, President, Diaspar
messageBody:
>So said Kirill Maximov on 2003-07-24 --------------------
>>>>How do I verify that command line arguments are
>>>>extracted corrctly to the right private member variables?
>
> I'd advice to test not values of these private variables but
> the behaviour of the class which depends on these values.
>
> If it is not possible, simply provide package-local methods
> to access these variables. But it is worse solution than testing
> behaviour.

This last suggestion is good to get tests passing. Refactor the needs for those methods away once the tests pass.


J. B. Rainsberger,
President, Diaspar Software Services
Let's write software that people understand.
http://www.diasparsoftware.com/
